result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason S Rivas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 4/01/2016; alternate 21 days jail. (payment plan fee added of $15.00)
DNA surcharge to be paid along with fine on payment plan.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jason S Rivas in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing. Court imposed the following sentence:

Fine of $893.00
DNA Surcharge of $200.00  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Defendant to pay $50.00 a month commencing 04/01/2015 or alternate of 21 days jail
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jason S Rivas in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion in Limine is withdrawn. Defendant enters a guilty plea to the charge. Matter is adjourned for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.
